DOC.brief_summary: To determine effectiveness , safety , cost efficiency associate CCTA-guided selective catheterization strategy stable patient without know CAD American Heart Association/ American College Cardiology Class II indication non-emergent invasive coronary angiography .
DOC.brief_title: Coronary Computed Tomographic Angiography Selective Cardiac Catheterization
DOC.detailed_description: A prospective , randomize control multicenter trial determine clinical cost effectiveness `` selective catheterization '' strategy versus `` direct catheterization '' strategy stable patient suspect without know CAD clinical indication non-emergent invasive coronary angiography . Subjects `` selective catheterization '' arm follow primary endpoint non-inferiority rate major adverse cardiac event ( MACE ) compare subject `` direct catheterization '' strategy .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA 1 . Age > 18 year 2 . Patients provide write informed consent 3 . Scheduled undergo clinicallyindicated nonemergent invasive coronary angiography ACC/AHA Class II indication EXCLUSION CRITERIA 1 . Known CAD ( myocardial infarction , PCI , CABG ) 2 . ACC/AHA Class I III indication ICA 3 . Noncardiac illness life expectancy < 2 year 4 . Inability provide write informed consent 5 . Concomitant participation another clinical trial subject subject investigational drug device 6 . Pregnant woman 7 . Allergy iodinate contrast agent 8 . Serum creatinine ≥1.5 mg/dl Glomerular Filtration Rate < 30 ml/min 9 . Uncontrolled Baseline irregular heart rhythm ( e.g. , atrial fibrillation , etc . ) 10 . Heart rate ≥100 beat per minute 12 ) Systolic blood pressure ≤90 mm Hg 13 ) Contraindications β blocker nitroglycerin 14 ) Known complex congenital heart disease 15 ) Body mass index > 35
